He is a Hungarian Jew with an anti-British bias and poses as an advocate of the cause of appressed eastern races. He was on a former occasion refused permission to visit India. 2. He has recently attempted to enlist the support of the Foreign Office, the British Council, and British uni versities for a ‘’Council of Higher Learning in the Oriental Humanities” which he claims to have founded in Washington. He has approached the Foreign Office on several occasions during the past few years and has always been given a wide berth. 3. Consulates and British Council representatives in countries which he may visit in the course of his present tour should be warned confidentlally to be on their guard and to give him no facilities or endouragement.

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in chronological order from the front to the rear of the file. File notes appear at the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 1-4; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence from the British Consulate General at Bushire and the Political Agent at Bahrain concerning the activities of Felix Valyi, a Hungarian Orientalist. In particular, are details of his plan for a 'world university' in Greece and a 'Council of Higher Learning in the Oriental Humanities'.
